article_title: Bayern Munich Boss Hoeness Sentenced to 3½ Years in Tax Case
article_text:
BERLIN—Uli Hoeness, one of Germany's biggest soccer legends and president of the country's most prominent soccer club, was sentenced to 3½ years in prison Thursday for large-scale tax evasion.

Mr. Hoeness—who helped West Germany win the 1974 World Cup and spent more than four decades with FC Bayern Munich, first as a player and later as team manager and president—was found guilty of evading €28.5 million ($39.6 million) in taxes,...

twitter.description: A German court sentenced the president of German soccer club Bayern Munich, Uli Hoeness, to 3½ years in prison for evading millions of euros in taxes.
twitter.creator: @HarrietTorry

image.alt: Bayern Munich soccer club boss gets 3½ years in prison for tax evasion.
